{"dictionaryId":"4dfff7cf-cd92-421b-9543-4c93997fe375","dataDictionary":{"citation":{"title":"Insect Emergence from Arctic Coastal Plain Thaw Ponds, 2012-2013","date":[{"date":"2022-10-25T23:30:55.009Z","dateType":"creation"}]},"subject":["collectionSite","dataDictionary","tabularDataset"],"responsibleParty":{"party":[{"contactId":"0000-0002-6096-0420"}],"role":"author"},"entity":[{"entityId":"089d0d8d-2d33-4363-a83a-c4a12e97e027","attribute":[{"allowNull":false,"attributeReference":{"title":"Author defined"},"codeName":"Site","dataType":"character varying","definition":"A concatenation of several data attributes. There are thirteen (13) unique sites addressed in this table. See Koch, et al., 2019. The "Site" field herein directly corresponds to the "Site" field in the table, pondCharacterization_sites_chippRBasin_koch_2013.csv, that provides a table of the latitude and longitude of each pond, information on the pond class, and treatment. Presented in a Comma Separated Value (CSV) formatted table, as found in the data release found at https://doi.org/10.5066/P9K5EV4N","domainId":"22663b81-2e91-4ca2-b31d-59f32f7ee8dc"},{"allowNull":false,"attributeReference":{"title":"Author defined"},"codeName":"SampleID","dataType":"character varying","definition":"Unique identifier of the pond sample at the time of collection","domainId":"353aa95b-7e5a-4489-b35d-34603edeb9d4"},{"allowNull":false,"attributeReference":{"title":"Author defined"},"codeName":"Taxon","dataType":"character varying","definition":"Unique concatenation of four alphabetic characters representing the taxon code combined with the life cycle stage of the identified insect. C only value, indicating center of pond.","domainId":"91c38f14-9fea-4282-8aca-1feaa023a936"},{"allowNull":false,"attributeReference":{"title":"Author defined"},"codeName":"Day","dataType":"integer","maxValue":"224","minValue":"171","definition":"Day in calendar year as counted from 1 to 365 (366 in leap years) that the sample was collected. Also known as the ordinal day of the year.","units":"Days","unitsResolution":1},{"allowNull":false,"attributeReference":{"title":"Author defined"},"codeName":"Cycle","dataType":"integer","maxValue":"9","minValue":"2","definition":"The ordinal week of collection; groups sets of samples together that were collected in the same week, but not on the same day.","units":"Week","unitsResolution":1},{"allowNull":false,"attributeReference":{"title":"Author defined"},"codeName":"Sarea","dataType":"integer","maxValue":"100","minValue":"52","definition":"Pond surface area bounded by the trap.","units":"Square centimeters","unitsResolution":1},{"allowNull":false,"attributeReference":{"title":"Author defined"},"codeName":"Class","dataType":"character varying","definition":"Type of pond. Family is the rank immediately above both Genus and Species.","domainId":"a35ad211-8245-4e2f-b3fa-9b8bc59338a1"}],"codeName":"emergeInsects_slopePonds_taxaRanks_NorthSlopeAK_Laske_2012_2013","definition":"Comma Separated Value (CSV) file containing data related to the taxonomic ranks of the 25 insect families found in the various pond types found in the Central Arctic North Slope, starting with the broader Infraclass down to the less broad Family taxonomic ranks. The taxonomic ranking above Infraclass can be found in the accompanying table, emergeInsects_slopePonds_insectData_NorthSlopeAK_Laske_2012_2013.csv.","entityReference":[{"title":"Author defined"}]}],"dictionaryIncludedWithResource":true,"locale":[{"language":"eng","country":"USA","characterSet":"UTF-8"}],"domain":[{"domainId":"3d09ac21-0b77-4566-9188-69a53f9d3cb6","codeName":"pond_class","commonName":"Pond Class","description":"A concatenation of several data attributes.

CN = Chipp North, name of study site

pond class -- the type of pond, KL - large coalescent pond, KS - small coalescent pond, P - low centered polygon pond, and TR - trough pond

treatment_pond_number -- the other portion of the study used various fertilizer treatments. Only control ponds were used. 1-3 are replicates of the pond class. One pond CONTROL3Re was picked up in 2013 when a new pond was needed, "Re", is the replacement."},{"domainId":"4a7e70b2-0596-4293-b61f-263796fdd7bb","codeName":"basin_id","description":"BasinID is a combination of site attributes: year - location - pond_class - treatment_pond_number - zone - cycle. 

location -- CN stand for Chipp North, the name of the study site; pond class -- the type of pond; KL - large coalescent pond, KS - small coalescent pond; P - low centered polygon pond; and TR - trough pond

treatment_pond_number -- the other portion of the study used various fertilizer treatments, used only the control ponds here. 1-3 are replicates of the pond class. One pond CONTROL3Re was picked up in 2013 when a new pond was needed, "Re", is the replacement.","commonName":"Basin Id"},{"domainId":"91c38f14-9fea-4282-8aca-1feaa023a936","domainItem":[{"reference":{"title":"Author defined"},"name":"C","value":"Center of pond","definition":"Center of pond"},{"name":"M","value":"Margin of pond","definition":"Margin of pond","reference":{"title":"Author defined"}}],"domainReference":{"title":"Author defined"},"codeName":"zone","description":"Domain for location of emergent insect trap deployment in a pond","commonName":"Zone"},{"domainId":"f59ab45d-370a-4913-9f3d-e8d40a85954c","domainItem":[{"name":"thermokarst_l","value":"Large thermokarst pond","definition":"Large thermokarst pond","reference":{"title":"Koch et al., 2014"}},{"name":"thermokarst_s","value":"Small thermokarst pond","definition":"Small thermokarst pond","reference":{"title":"Koch et al., 2014"}},{"name":"polygon","value":"Polygon pond","definition":"Polygon pond","reference":{"title":"Koch et al., 2014"}},{"name":"trough","value":"Trough pond","definition":"Trough pond","reference":{"title":"Koch et al., 2014"}}],"domainReference":{"title":"Koch, J.C., Gurney, K. and Wipfli, M.S., 2014, Morphology-dependent water budgets and nutrient fluxes in Arctic thaw ponds: Permafrost and Periglacial Processes, 25(2), pp. 79-93; doi.org/10.1002/ppp.1804"},"codeName":"class","description":"Type of pond","commonName":"Class"},{"domainId":"8c8f4447-f80c-4564-ad97-ebd70c90ef28","domainReference":{"title":"Author defined"},"codeName":"NULL","commonName":"Null","description":"Empty of data, signifying no data was captured or is applicable"},{"domainId":"8cb2cafc-7071-4dd2-a3db-be675af543c2","domainReference":{"title":"Integrated Taxonomic Information System (ITIS)"},"codeName":"infraclass","description":"The principal taxonomic category that ranks animals (insects) above Superorder and below Subclass.
